column5: The Management, Finance and Accounting - MSc at the University of Leicester is a course that provides students with an understanding of accounting, finance, financial management and organisational performance. The course features a combination of core and option modules which allow you to focus on areas of interest that relate to your professional needs. You will develop an understanding of the main theories, models, frameworks, and techniques of management through rigorous teaching in the concepts of financial management and accounting as well as general management tools and techniques. As well as specific knowledge of financial management and accounting, this degree will develop your ability to analyse and evaluate management problems and sound strategic decisions. It will also help build practical skills such as research abilities (both online & offline), time management skills communication skills (written & verbal), presentation skills, & planning skills. This degree prepares students for careers in public or private sector organisations at a managerial level who wish to specialize in finance or accounting
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
